general

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CheckerPiece

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic piece in a board game such as Chess or Checkers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.awt.Color color
      The color of this piece, used to identify which player it is associated with.
      private java.lang.String icon
      A single character String used to represent this piece in a terminal.
      private java.lang.String imageIconPath
      The path to the ImageIcon used to represent this piece in a GUI in resources/images/.
      private Side side
      The side of the board this piece starts on.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Creates a new Piece with a blank icon.

      Creates a new Piece with the specified values.

        Parameters:

        g - The graphics context used to draw this piece.
        x - The x coordinate to draw this piece at.
        y - The y coordinate to draw this piece at.
        width - The width to scale this piece's ImageIcon to.
        height - The height to scale this piece's ImageIcon to.

      • hasMoves

        public boolean hasMoves(Piece[][] board,
                        int[] current)
        Finds whether or not this piece has valid moves on board.
        Parameters:
        board - The board the moves should work on.
        current - The position of this piece, to save time that would be used searching.
        Returns:
        Whether or not there are any valid moves.

      • getMoves

        public abstract java.util.List<int[]> getMoves(Piece[][] board,
                                               int[] current)
        Finds all valid moves for this piece on board.
        Parameters:
        board - The board the moves should work on.
        current - The position of this piece, to save time that would be used searching.
        Returns:
        A list of all valid moves as coordinates. If there are multiple stops, each coordinate is appended to the end of the list in order.
